GOD.content: the 2 economies of salary [Christianity]: retribution (exchange), and love of foreigner; latter an interruption, an exceeding of the economy of the community, of Schmitt’s strict politics, interrupts self-consciousness, inaugurates exchange
GOD.linkedContent: the 2 economies of salary [Christianity]: retribution (exchange), and love of foreigner; latter an interruption, an exceeding of the economy of the community, of Schmitt’s strict politics, interrupts self-consciousness, inaugurates exchange

PAS.content: simulacrum of circle, EROS, the double pas, he/it that says viens inaugurates it by responding déjà
PAS.linkedContent: simulacrum of circle, EROS, the double pas, he/it that says viens inaugurates it by responding déjà

PAS.content: the first sentence, no matter how inaugural it may seem, always recites itself in advance
PAS.linkedContent: the first sentence, no matter how inaugural it may seem, always recites itself in advance

DS.content: Mallarmé’s mime inaugurates, breaks into white page, follows no program
DS.linkedContent: Mallarmé’s mime inaugurates, breaks into white page, follows no program

FS.content: it’s because writing is inaugural that it is dangerous and anguishing, doesn’t know where it’s going, essential precipitation toward meaning that it constitutes—is its future
FS.linkedContent: it’s because writing is inaugural that it is dangerous and anguishing, doesn’t know where it’s going, essential precipitation toward meaning that it constitutes—is its future

FS.content: meaning must await being said/written in order to inhabit itself
FS.linkedContent: meaning must await being said/written in order to inhabit itself

DST.content: no matter how “free” or deconstructed the response, one cannot reduce the delay (retard): an event, a law, a call are already there (others are there, for/before whom one must answer); “response inaugurates nothing if it does not come after”
DST.linkedContent: no matter how “free” or deconstructed the response, one cannot reduce the delay (retard): an event, a law, a call are already there (others are there, for/before whom one must answer); “response inaugurates nothing if it does not come after”

PIO.content: no invention w/out advent, singular structure of event, makes come about what is new in a “first time ever,” [cf. première fois] inauguration of a possibility/power at disposal of everyone, thus conventions, belonging to a culture (heritage, pedagogical institution, discipline)
PIO.linkedContent: no invention w/out advent, singular structure of event, makes come about what is new in a “first time ever,” [cf. première fois] inauguration of a possibility/power at disposal of everyone, thus conventions, belonging to a culture (heritage, pedagogical institution, discipline)

PIO.content: for something to be a first time must also be a last time > archaeology & eschatology acknowledge each other in irony of one & only instant
PIO.linkedContent: for something to be a first time must also be a last time > archaeology & eschatology acknowledge each other in irony of one & only instant

PIO.content: fable, logos, performative demonstration of thing it’s saying, says the saying: [in the beginning was the word] incipit, dispatch (envoi), evangelical message
PIO.linkedContent: fable, logos, performative demonstration of thing it’s saying, says the saying: [in the beginning was the word] incipit, dispatch (envoi), evangelical message

PIO.content: Ponge’s “Fable”: poetic performative, describes/carries out, on same line, its own generation; telling & told are undecidable, its constative is its performative (not content w/ announcing, it’s located ironically in evangelical tradition, reveals/perverts structure of envoi)
PIO.linkedContent: Ponge’s “Fable”: poetic performative, describes/carries out, on same line, its own generation; telling & told are undecidable, its constative is its performative (not content w/ announcing, it’s located ironically in evangelical tradition, reveals/perverts structure of envoi)

PIO.content: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition
PIO.linkedContent: inventive event as both quotation & narrative [re: “Fable”], allegory & tautegory > event of an utterance, its vis inventiva, inseparable from syntactic play, also an art of disposition

PIO.content: shouldn’t an inaugural invention deny/overflow environment of reception (which shouldn’t be able to welcome an authentic invention)? thus producing a disordering mechanism for every status assignable to it? isn’t an invention spontaneously deconstructive?
PIO.linkedContent: shouldn’t an inaugural invention deny/overflow environment of reception (which shouldn’t be able to welcome an authentic invention)? thus producing a disordering mechanism for every status assignable to it? isn’t an invention spontaneously deconstructive?

PIO.content: invention’s “first time”: inaugural event and iterability > thus, no invention w/out status, w/out introduction or promise of publicity; iterability marked, remarked, at origin of invention, elle y forme une poche du premier instant: retroverted anticipation
PIO.linkedContent: invention’s “first time”: inaugural event and iterability > thus, no invention w/out status, w/out introduction or promise of publicity; iterability marked, remarked, at origin of invention, elle y forme une poche du premier instant: retroverted anticipation

PIO.content: to invent is to produce iterability, & the machine for reproduction/simulation
PIO.linkedContent: to invent is to produce iterability, & the machine for reproduction/simulation

AFR.content: Locke inaugurates—but after Bacon & Newton (philosophy records pre-existence of good minds), philosophers are the first to recognize genius (Locke recognized Bacon)
AFR.linkedContent: Locke inaugurates—but after Bacon & Newton (philosophy records pre-existence of good minds), philosophers are the first to recognize genius (Locke recognized Bacon)

AFR.content: how can Locke carve out a trail while repeating an earlier rupture? he applied a general law to particular domain
AFR.linkedContent: how can Locke carve out a trail while repeating an earlier rupture? he applied a general law to particular domain

AFR.content: by preceding analogically, he discovered an unknown > invention by analogy (or analysis): new “objects” created by transposing, proportioning, analyzing
AFR.linkedContent: by preceding analogically, he discovered an unknown > invention by analogy (or analysis): new “objects” created by transposing, proportioning, analyzing

IW.content: coming of an event initiates irruption (volcano), rupture and hence interruption of totalizing synthesis
IW.linkedContent: coming of an event initiates irruption (volcano), rupture and hence interruption of totalizing synthesis

EL.content: return, repetition, revenance, the re- in language, as language insofar as it inaugurates possibility of revenge in language
EL.linkedContent: return, repetition, revenance, the re- in language, as language insofar as it inaugurates possibility of revenge in language

C.content: w/out example because series will have posed singular problem of initiality
C.linkedContent: w/out example because series will have posed singular problem of initiality

LI.content: “from the inception on (dès l’entame) as broached and breached (entamée) in its “origin” by iterability” [re: “-bility”]
LI.linkedContent: “from the inception on (dès l’entame) as broached and breached (entamée) in its “origin” by iterability” [re: “-bility”]

TN.content: auto-hetero-affection inaugurates all experience: speech, declaration of love
TN.linkedContent: auto-hetero-affection inaugurates all experience: speech, declaration of love

NOY.content: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity
NOY.linkedContent: the “second” yes, doit arriver comme un renouvellement absolu, the structural “forgetting” of fidelity

NOY.content: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second”
NOY.linkedContent: “grâce… à la menace de cet oubli [the cutting off, the becoming unique, the divisibility contre laquelle une signature se tend] la mémoire de la promesse, la promesse même peut franchir son premier pas, à savoir le second”

NOY.content: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”
NOY.linkedContent: forgetting repetition in the promise so that “yes” is absolutely inaugural and “free”

AD.content: [re: Levinas] as w/ all thoughts that are sources, I will never stop beginning to think anew on basis of new beginning they give me
AD.linkedContent: [re: Levinas] as w/ all thoughts that are sources, I will never stop beginning to think anew on basis of new beginning they give me

AD.content: w/ Levinas, “yes” of faith not incompatible w/ atheism—or certain inexistence of God > à-Dieu, unique, more than old, inaugural (& replaceable, exposed to inanities)
AD.linkedContent: w/ Levinas, “yes” of faith not incompatible w/ atheism—or certain inexistence of God > à-Dieu, unique, more than old, inaugural (& replaceable, exposed to inanities)

SPEC.content: [re: Freud’s Beyond…] Bindung inaugurates, assures, overflows PP (mastery), as seat of its condition
